sub_tasks.requirements: Gender Selection: Filters for female patients using `p.gender = 'F'`.
Age Range Selection: Correctly calculates and filters for patients aged between 55 and 65 at the time of admission.
AMI Diagnosis Selection: Identifies patients with an Acute Myocardial Infarction (AMI) diagnosis using appropriate ICD-9 ('410%') and ICD-10 ('I21%') codes.
Cohort Table Joins: Correctly joins `patients`, `admissions`, and `diagnoses_icd` tables to build the initial AMI cohort.
Lab Data Join: Correctly joins the AMI cohort with the `labevents` table on `hadm_id` to link admissions to lab results.
Troponin Test Identification: Correctly identifies High-Sensitivity Troponin T (hs-TnT) tests using `itemid = 51003`.
First Troponin Logic: Uses a window function (`ROW_NUMBER`) partitioned by `hadm_id` and ordered by `charttime` to isolate the first troponin test for each admission.
Troponin Threshold Filter: Correctly filters for first troponin values greater than 0.01 ng/mL (`troponin_t_value > 0.01`).
Patient Count Aggregation: Correctly calculates the count of unique patients using `COUNT(DISTINCT subject_id)`.
Admission Count Aggregation: Correctly calculates the count of admissions using `COUNT(hadm_id)`.
Statistical Calculations: Correctly computes the mean (`AVG`), median (`APPROX_QUANTILES`), and Interquartile Range (IQR) for the first hs-TnT values.
